ys.succinct.xml.dom

Class DocumentContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • ys.succinct.xml.dom.DocumentContext

  • public class DocumentContext
extends Object
    An object that holds the properties of the XML document like the XML declaration, URI, etc.
    Author:
    Yauheni Shahun

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DocumentContext(String URI, String inputEncoding, String xmlEncoding, String xmlVersion, boolean isXmlStandalone)
      Constructs a document context.

    • Method Summary

      String getInputEncoding()
      Returns the encoding of the XML input.

      Returns the document URI or null if unknown.

      Returns the encoding of the XML document.
      String getXmlVersion()
      Returns the XML version string, e.g.
      boolean isXmlStandalone()
      Indicates whether the XML document depends on the external subset of the DTD.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentContext

        public DocumentContext(String URI,
               String inputEncoding,
               String xmlEncoding,
               String xmlVersion,
               boolean isXmlStandalone)
        Constructs a document context.
        Parameters:
        inputEncoding - the encoding of the XML input
        xmlEncoding - the XML encoding
        xmlVersion - the XML version
        isXmlStandalone - the flag that indicates if the XML depends on the external DTD

    • Method Detail

      • getURI

        public String getURI()
        Returns the document URI or null if unknown.

      • getInputEncoding

        public String getInputEncoding()
        Returns the encoding of the XML input.

      • getXmlEncoding

        public String getXmlEncoding()
        Returns the encoding of the XML document.

      • getXmlVersion

        public String getXmlVersion()
        Returns the XML version string, e.g. "1.0".

      • isXmlStandalone

        public boolean isXmlStandalone()
        Indicates whether the XML document depends on the external subset of the DTD.
        Returns:
        true if the XML doesn't depend on the external entities, otherwise false
